page.title: 18A LOCAL PUBLISHER
page.content: Meresborough books are a specialist publisher of books about kent,based at Rainham Bookshop in Station Road.Their titles,in excess of 60,to date,cover all subjects of local interest,ranging from the origins of place names to the supernatural.1890 to 1920 are the years mostly under review,though some books cover material up to 1945.Authors are commissioned for specialised subjects, but,more usually,local people offer ideas or manuscripts for acceptance. Paper and hardback books are available, plus a monthly journal "Bygone Kent", on all aspects of Kent history,founded in 1979.Mackays of Chatham print the standard booklets,many of which are in large format,and well illustrated with old photographs and postcards. Meresborough Books have a mail order system as far as Australia.
